description: Goalkeeper Conor Devlin signs a new contract to extend his stay with Premiership champions Cliftonville.
title: Goalkeeper Conor Devlin extends stay with Cliftonville
title_page: Goalkeeper Conor Devlin extends stay with Cliftonville - BBC Sport
maintext:
Goalkeeper Conor Devlin has signed a new contract to extend his stay with Premiership champions Cliftonville.
The 23-year-old is currently sidelined with a shoulder injury and his present deal was due to expire at the end of the season.
Devlin has won two Premiership titles and two League Cups, as well as Charity and County Antrim Shield honours, since joining the Reds in 2012.
The ex-Northern Ireland Under-21 player has made 118 appearances for the Reds.
